docs.lead_paragraph: The desires of the British prime minister to cut the budget deficit are running up against a situation created over decades: the large number of public entitlements.

headline.main: In Britain, Austerity Collides With Pension System
headline.print_headline: In Britain, Austerity Collides With Pension System

docs.abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron's efforts to cut the budget deficit are colliding with the government pension system; government spending, including public entitlements, continues to rise and is projected to approach 700 billion pounds in 2012, or 45 percent of gross domestic product; issue in some ways parallels the challenge facing the United States.
docs.snippet: The desires of the British prime minister to cut the budget deficit are running up against a situation created over decades: the large number of public entitlements.

docs.lead_paragraph: The dispute over ritual circumcision in Germany reflects the secularization of European life that, in the eyes of some religious leaders, has mutated into a form of intolerance.

headline.seo: Circumcision Debate in Germany Reflects Religious-Secular Tensions
headline.main: Some Religious Leaders See a Threat as Europe Grows More Secular
headline.print_headline: Some Religious Leaders See a Threat as Europe Grows More Secular

docs.abstract: Dispute over ritual circumcision in Germany reflects the secularization of European life that, in the eyes of some Jewish and Muslim religious leaders, has mutated into a form of intolerance.
docs.snippet: The dispute over ritual circumcision in Germany reflects the secularization of European life that, in the eyes of some religious leaders, has mutated into a form of intolerance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thirty years after the Korean boxer Duk-koo Kim died following his loss to Ray (Boom Boom) Mancini in Las Vegas, their families continue to heal.

headline.seo: Families Continue to Heal 30 Years After Title Fight Between Ray Mancini and Duk-koo Kim

docs.abstract: Families of boxers Ray Mancini and Duk-koo Kim continue to heal 30 years after 1982 title fight between the men left Kim dead.
docs.snippet: Thirty years after the Korean boxer Duk-koo Kim died following his loss to Ray (Boom Boom) Mancini in Las Vegas, their families continue to heal.

docs.lead_paragraph: The story of Lia Lee, the severely brain-damaged daughter of Hmong refugees, inspired a book that affected the way American medicine is practiced across cultures.

headline.main: Lia Lee Dies; Life Went On Around Her, Redefining Care
headline.print_headline: Life Went On Around Her, Redefining Care by Bridging a Divide

docs.abstract: Lia Lee, severely brain-damaged daughter of Hmong refugees who had resettled in California, died in Sacamento on Aug 31 after spending the last 26 of her 30 years in a persistent vegetative state; Lia, who suffered heavily from seizures, was the subject of Ann Fadiman's 1997 book The Spirit Catches You and You Fall Down.
docs.snippet: The story of Lia Lee, the severely brain-damaged daughter of Hmong refugees, inspired a book that affected the way American medicine is practiced across cultures.
